Function Documentation

static CSP csp_eye ( int  n  )  [static]

Create an identity matrix of size n as a cs struct.

The structure must be freed with cs_free by the caller.

Parameters:
n size of identity matrix to construct.
Returns:
pointer to a cs object that contains the identity matrix.

cs* Matrix_as_cs ( cs *  ans,
SEXP  x,
Rboolean  check_Udiag 
)

Create a cs object with the contents of x.

Typically called via AS_CSP()

Parameters:
ans pointer to a cs struct. This is allocated in the caller so it is easier to keep track of where it should be freed - in many applications the memory can be allocated with alloca and automatically freed on exit from the caller.
x pointer to an object that inherits from CsparseMatrix
check_Udiag boolean - should a check for (and consequent expansion of) a unit diagonal be performed.
Returns:
pointer to a cs object that contains pointers to the slots of x.

Copy the contents of a to an appropriate CsparseMatrix object and, optionally, free a or free both a and the pointers to its contents.
